title: Descent direction
summary: In optimization, a descent direction is a vector p ∈ R n {\displaystyle \mathbf {p} \in \mathbb {R} ^{n}} that points towards a local minimum x ∗ {\displaystyle \mathbf {x} ^{*}} of an objective function f : R n → R {\displaystyle f:\mathbb {R} ^{n}\to \mathbb {R} } .
